titlestmt.titleproper: Stella Ben-Dorr letter and photograph to Alfred Bellinger, 1950
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2011

change.item: Imported into EADitor. Some normalization has occurred to apply EAD 2002 schema validation and conform to EADitor basic requirements.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Stella Ben-Dorr letter and photograph to Alfred Bellinger
did.abstract: Letter and photograph concerning three Roman coins.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Stella Ben-Dor was lecturer of the numismatics course at Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Letter (July 13, 1950) from Stella Ben-Dor to Professor Alfred Bellinger of Yale University, concerning three Roman coins (Lucilla and Commodus) with reverse legends incomplete and found in Palestine, along with one photograph of coins.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Stella Ben-Dorr letter and photograph to Alfred Bellinger, 1950, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
